Content_wSideColumn.Title: Education Week: Accomodations
Content_wSideColumn.Abstract: On-campus/Off-campus housing is limited to first-come, first-served.

Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Food Services

Meals can be purchased at your convenience in the Manwaring Center  Crossroads Food Court.

Campus Housing

On-campus housing is limited to first-come, first-served.   A full-program pass must be purchased prior to securing housing.  Types of on-campus housing are listed below.

  • Individual and Group Housing- $69/person (housed with other individuals)
  • Married Couple - $169 (housed in own unit)
Note:  All beds are raised approximately five feet off the floor with bed rails available upon request.  If you are unable to climb into a raised bed, please consider off-campus housing or other housing arrangements.
  • The dorms have raised beds and no air conditioning.
  • Two or three bedroom apartments (four- to-six twin beds) with bathroom and living area.
  • Men's housing is dormitory-style rooms (two twin beds) with shared bathroom facilities and central lounge.
Items Provided:

The following items are provided (per person):  soap, washcloth, towel, two flat sheets, blanket, pillow, and pillowcase.  Micro-refrigerators and microwaves are available in most rooms.

Items Not Provided:

The use of the oven or stove is not permitted.  Also, cups, plates, pots, pans, and silverware are not furnished in any of the apartments. Telephones will not be accessible in most rooms. Hangers are not provided.

Participants may consider bringing a personal bed fan due to the fact that there is no air conditioning.

Off-campus housing in student apartment complexes has been reserved for Education Week attendees and can be requested.  These apartments have either four or six twin beds that are normal height off the floor. Individual and group housing- $69/person and married couple housing- $169

Note:  Please request which type of housing (on-campus or off-campus) that is preferred.  Notify our office of any special considerations such as walking limitation, stairs, etc.

Sheets, bedding, soap, washcloth, towel, pillow, pillowcase, and shower curtain are not provided. The use of the oven or stove is not permitted.
Assignment of Roommates:

On-campus/Off-campus housing is limited to first-come, first-served.

  • Early requests do not necessarily correlate with location of housing.
  • Participants who come alone will be assigned a roommate of their own gender.
  • Couples will be housed in their own unit.  Groups of more than six will be assigned adjoining apartments or rooms.
Restrictions and Guidelines:

No infants or children under the age of 14 will be allowed in campus housing including babies. Participants ages 14-18 must be accompanied by an adult. Honor Code observance is required in campus housing.

Off-campus Lodging

These listings are for informational purposes only. BYU-Idaho does not endorse any of these companies nor has BYU-Idaho investigated any of these companies to determine their compliance with state or federal regulations or their business standing. Before using any of these carriers, BYU-Idaho recommends that you determine if they are appropriate for your needs.
